Description: Large bowl of marl pottery with a flat base and slightly incurving rim, red slip on the interior and applied just over the exterior lip in a careless manner. On the interior the slip is loosely burnished vertically and then horizontally as criss-cross. Rim warped during manufacture, not round.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Identified as Late ware L16g in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery by Baumgartel in Petrie’s Naqada Excavations: A Supplement (London 1970), p. xxii. For the excavations at Naqada see W.M.F. Petrie, Naqada and Ballas (London 1896). Marked 521 on side in ink.
